title: Bullpen woes, L.A.'s offensive troubles, Toronto's power: What we've learned so far
content: With the World Series resuming in Los Angeles, we break down what we've seen so far -- and what to expect.

title: NBA memo: Must assess 'dire risks' of gambling
content: An NBA memo sent to teams said the league is reassessing its measures on legal sports betting, how it should be regulated and ways to protect players from "dire risks."

title: Source: Wentz to have season-ending surgery
content: Vikings quarterback Carson Wentz will undergo season-ending surgery on his left shoulder, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Ex-NFL star Peterson still in jail after DWI arrest
content: Former NFL running back Adrian Peterson remained jailed on Monday after being arrested a day earlier in a Houston suburb on charges of driving while intoxicated and unlawfully carrying a weapon.

title: Smart on Kelly, SEC firings: 'The world we live in'
content: Georgia's Kirby Smart, asked about LSU's Brian Kelly becoming the latest high-profile coach to have been fired, said, "It's the world we live in."

title: Bengals defense meets after 'unacceptable' play
content: A historically poor showing on their home field produced a players-only meeting for Cincinnati's defense on Monday, a day after the Bengals' 39-38 loss at Paycor Stadium to the New York Jets, a last-place club that was winless entering the weekend.

title: Longhorns QB Manning in concussion protocol
content: Texas QB Arch Manning is in concussion protocol and did not practice Monday, as the Longhorns prepare to face No. 9 Vanderbilt on Saturday. An update on Manning is expected later this week.

title: Lockett joins Raiders; reunites with Carroll, Geno
content: Veteran wide receiver Tyler Lockett, who was released by the Titans last week, has signed with the Las Vegas Raiders.

content: Lando Norris hasn't been F1's title favorite for some time, but his Mexico win puts him atop the standings.

content: Fabio Wardley called Oleksandr Usyk out after his win over Joseph Parker. Will the fight actually happen? And can Wardley win?

title: Moultrie & Co. get Hayes' team back playing 'the USA way'
content: For a team that prides itself on playing "the USA way," Sunday's 3-1 win over Portugal was a good response to Thursday's shock loss.

title: CPI Ministers to boycott Cabinet demanding withdrawal from PM SHRI pact
content: CPI general secretary D. Raja calls Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan‚Äôs reasons for joining the contentious scheme unconvincing.  Kerala government should have taken its cue from Tamil Nadu and moved the Supreme Court for unconditional and obligatory federal funding for education, he says

title: BJP hits out at Opposition over its stand on SIR 2.0
content: BJP national spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla alleged that Congress and other Opposition parties are targeting the Election Commission and using the SIR as an excuse for the ‚Äúimpending losses‚Äù in the coming polls

title: INDIA bloc to release poll manifesto on October 28; Rahul to join campaign
content: Rahul Gandhi to hold his first election campaign in Muzaffarpur and Darbhanga on October 29; Tejashwi slams the Central government and accuses it of ‚Äútelling lies‚Äù about running special trains during Chhath

title: Muhammad Yunus sparks controversy with controversial map on book presented to Pakistan military general
content: The map in question was printed on the cover of a book that was presented to Chairman of Pakistan‚Äôs Joint Chiefs of Staff Committee (CJCSC) General Sahir Shamshad Mirza

title: Experts link fatal mudslip to poor road stability measures in Idukki
content: Experts blame unscientific slope cutting practices for landslips on the the Kochi-Dhanushkodi stretch.

title: Only God will do justice, says father of Bihar youth jailed for abusing PM during Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs Voter Adhikar Yatra
content: Mohammed Rizvi‚Äôs only crime is his poor family background, he had been coaxed into committing the mistake, says his father, who runs a small two-wheeler repair shop at Bharwara village; he says the police haven‚Äôt given him a copy of the FIR and he lacks the resources to hire a lawyer for his son

title: Odisha deploys disaster response forces to tackle Cyclone Montha
content: All district administrations have been asked to ensure ‚Äòzero casualty‚Äô in the natural disaster, said Suresh Pujari, State Revenue and Disaster Management Minister

title: Chetan and Ajit carry family legacies into Bihar battle
content: Two candidates from the Rajput community have distinct profiles ‚Äì while one is battling the legacy of a ‚Äòdon‚Äô, the other is following the footsteps of a man who has never compromised on his ideology

title: Cyclone set to cross coast; red alert in 16 A.P. districts
content: Cyclonic storm Montha is very likely to cross Andhra Pradesh coast between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam around Kakinada in the evening or night of Oct.28 as a severe cyclonic storm with a maximum sustained wind speed of 90-100 kmph, says IMD; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to ensure that relief reaches the public without delay

title: Voters in rural Bihar still reluctant to rally behind ‚Äòuntested‚Äô Jan Suraaj
content: From distrust to disinterest, JSP struggles with low recall and credibility in the State‚Äôs hinterlands. However, urban voters who have grievances with the current government but are uncomfortable voting for the Tejashwi Yadav-led Grand Alliance, do see Prashant Kishor‚Äôs party as an alternative

title: Black hole activities suppress the birth of new stars around it: Study
content: ‚ÄòIt reveals that both intense radiation from around the black holes as well as the high-speed jets they emit can work together to eject gas from the centres of galaxies, potentially shutting down star formation in their central regions and regulating galactic growth.

title: T.N. will fight any attempt to disenfranchise its people, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: DMK and its allies have called for an all-party meeting on the SIR of electoral rolls on November 2. The leaders alleged that the functioning of the EC was not only controversial but also suspicious

title: Digital arrest is one of the most dreaded threats to citizens: President Murmu
content: Addressing Indian Police Service probationers, the President referred to the growing trend of fraudsters impersonating law enforcement officers, and extorting money by threatening victims with arrest or the freezing of bank accounts

title: Election Commission modifies some SIR rules after Bihar
content: No documents are to be collected from electors during the Enumeration Phase, the ECI said in a notice issued to the Chief Electoral Officers of the 12 States and Union Territories where the SIR will be carried out next

title: Navy‚Äôs top maritime forum, the Indo-Pacific Regional Dialogue 2025, opens today
content: The IPRD 2025 aims to strengthen multilateral cooperation, promote regional stability, and advance the shared vision of a resilient and prosperous Indo-Pacific

title: Japanese PM Takaichi faces her first big diplomatic test with Trump talks
content: The meeting will be watched closely in Delhi¬†for any clarity between the two leaders on India‚Äôs plans to host the delayed Quad summit; the visit to Japan comes just before Trump‚Äôs meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in South Korea

title: Well-prepared for SIR in Kerala, says Kelkar
content: Steps being taken to avoid ‚Äòdual duty‚Äô trouble for officers as SIR coincides with 2025 local body polls, says Rathan Kelkar

title: Chief Information Commissioner appointments in 'two or three' weeks, Centre tells SC
content: ‚ÄúThe best way to kill the RTI is to not make any appointments‚Ä¶ If they do make appointments, they select persons out of the blue. Names are just air-dropped. There is no information on who is being appointed,‚Äù said Prashant Bhushan.

title: SC raps Delhi police for delay in filing response to bail pleas of 2020 riots accused
content: The top court said most of the accused in the larger 2020 Delhi riots conspiracy case have already spent nearly five years in custody

title: Cyclone Montha: Andhra braces for landfall tonight; admin on high alert
content: Cyclonic storm Montha is heading towards Andhra Pradesh, expected to make landfall near Kakinada around midnight Tuesday with wind speeds of 90-100 kmph. Authorities have placed several districts on high alert, established rehabilitation centers, and deployed NDRF and SDRF teams. Heavy rains and strong winds are also anticipated in southern Odisha and northern Tamil Nadu.

title: 'Losing hope': Omar Abdullah on J&K statehood restoration; refuses to speak on future as CM
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah admitted his optimism for statehood restoration is fading, citing delays as a hurdle for the elected government. He also addressed internal party criticism and asserted the National Conference's opposition to the BJP in the region.

title: Nvidia, the biggest success story of the AI boom, gets a 'mighty American' rival
content: Qualcomm, a smartphone chip giant, has launched new AI processors, AI200 and AI250, challenging Nvidia's dominance in the lucrative data center market.  These chips target AI inference, with advanced cooling and memory bandwidth.  The move sent Qualcomm's stock soaring, signaling a significant shift in the AI hardware landscape.

title: Big relief: H-4 visa holders keep right to work in US - will Trump change it?
content: The US Supreme Court has ended a decade-long legal fight, allowing H-4 visa holders, primarily spouses of H-1B workers, to continue working. This decision upholds employment authorization for those facing green card backlogs.

title: How did Cody ‚ÄúBeef‚Äù Franke die? Inside Barstool star‚Äôs tragic death
content: Cody "Beef" Franke, a beloved personality on Barstool Sports' Fore Play golf podcast, has tragically passed away at 31 following a sudden medical event. Known for his infectious humor and passion for golf, Franke was a former PGA professional who joined Barstool in 2025.

title: MAGA wants Mamdani out: Zohran's US citizenship under scanner; 'anti-American' remarks draw ire
content: Prominent MAGA Republicans are demanding the DOJ investigate New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani, seeking to revoke his citizenship and deport him. They cite alleged undisclosed affiliations with the Democratic Socialists of America and past remarks.

title: Bank locker holding seized jewellery worth Rs 90 lakh disappears; Allahabad HC seeks pay-out
content: A taxpayer whose gold jewellery, seized by Income Tax authorities and stored in a bank locker, was stolen, has won a compensation case. The Allahabad High Court ruled that the Income Tax Department is responsible for the loss and must compensate the petitioner.

title: GM layoffs: Engineers fired on Microsoft Teams; Says it's business, not you
content: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: 'Worth over Rs 25 crore': Drugs dropped from Pak drones in Jammu; seized by BSF
content: BSF troops in Jammu's RS Pura sector seized over 5.3kg of heroin, valued at Rs 25 crore, believed to be dropped by a Pakistani drone. This seizure highlights ongoing efforts by Pakistan-based smugglers to infiltrate narcotics into India, with recent arrests in Kathua uncovering a wider syndicate.

title: Pancreas health: 5 warning signs, causes and prevention tips
content: Your pancreas, crucial for digestion and blood sugar, can signal distress through persistent abdominal pain, unexplained weight loss, nausea, blood sugar imbalance, and jaundice. These early warnings, often overlooked, necessitate prompt medical attention to prevent serious conditions like pancreatitis or diabetes. Lifestyle choices like limiting alcohol and maintaining a balanced diet are key to pancreatic health.

title: Trump impact? Surge in India's crude import from US; why its moving away from Russia
content: India has significantly increased its crude oil imports from the US, reaching 540,000 barrels per day in October. This move aims to diversify oil sources beyond Russia and address trade concerns with the Trump administration, while also navigating new sanctions on Russian oil giants.

title: Joe Alwyn slammed as old video with Taylor Swift goes viral amid Kelce praise
content: Taylor Swift's upcoming wedding to Travis Kelce has fans buzzing, especially after a resurfaced clip from 2022 showing her with ex Joe Alwyn sparked outrage.  Fans criticized Alwyn's apparent rush to avoid paparazzi, contrasting it with Kelce's public support for Swift's success.  The couple remains private about their wedding details.

title: Is Jayden Daniels playing tonight vs Chiefs? Washington QB injury update
content: Jayden Daniels, the Commanders' dynamic quarterback, is sidelined tonight against the Chiefs due to a hamstring injury sustained last week. This setback follows a previous knee issue. Veteran Marcus Mariota will start, with Washington targeting Week 9 for Daniels' potential return. Keeping their young star healthy is crucial for the team's season.

title: Cardi B opens up on emotional toll of motherhood before baby with Stefon Diggs
content: Cardi B is expecting her fourth child with Stefon Diggs and recently shared her struggles with breastfeeding, which made her feel "less of a woman." She advocates for mothers using formula, emphasizing that feeding a child is paramount. Cardi B has consistently spoken out against judging mothers' choices regarding feeding methods.

title: World‚Äôs first AI minister: 'Diella' to give birth to 83 ‚ÄòAI children‚Äô
content: Albania's Prime Minister Edi Rama announced their AI minister, Diella, is 'pregnant' with 83 digital 'offspring.' These AI assistants will aid Socialist Party MPs, enhancing parliamentary efficiency and transparency. Diella, the world's first AI minister, was appointed to combat corruption in government tenders, marking a significant step in integrating AI into governance.

title: Racial hate crime: Indian-origin woman raped in UK; 32-yr-old ‚Äòwhite male‚Äô held
content: A 32-year-old man was arrested following a manhunt after an alleged racially aggravated rape of a 20-year-old Indian-origin woman in Walsall. Police are treating the attack as racially motivated and are providing full support to the victim. The incident has sparked outrage and calls for justice from community leaders and MPs.

title: AB de Villiers explodes: 'Cockroaches crawl out to attack' ‚Äî defends Rohit & Kohli
content: Former cricketer AB de Villiers has strongly defended Indian stars Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. He criticized those spreading negativity about the players. De Villiers stated that both cricketers deserve celebration for their contributions. Kohli and Sharma recently silenced critics with strong performances in an ODI series against Australia. Their efforts secured a significant win for India.

title: Gondola cable car project: J&K seeks NIA nod to resume work; halted since Pahalgam attack
content: Jammu and Kashmir government seeks NIA permission for ground surveys for a proposed 1.4km gondola project in Pahalgam, aiming to revive tourism after a recent terrorist attack. The Rs 120 crore project, stalled due to security concerns, will connect Yatri Niwas to Baisaran.  Winter tourism is also being boosted with a ski lift plan.

title: J&K RS poll: Deputy CM accuses BJP of 'stealing' votes; party hits back
content: Allegations of cross-voting rocked the J&K assembly as Deputy CM Surinder Choudhary accused BJP of "stealing four votes" in the recent Rajya Sabha elections. This led to a heated exchange, with NC legislators calling BJP members "vote chor" after the saffron party secured a surprise victory with 32 votes, exceeding its assembly strength.

title: 'Govt chooses voters': Oppn takes shot at SIR 2.0; who said what
content: Opposition leaders have fiercely criticized the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, alleging it's a 'vote theft' tactic to favor the BJP. Accusations of government pressure and manipulation of voter lists have surfaced, with concerns raised about the transparency and fairness of the process, particularly following similar exercises in Bihar.

title: Barstool golf star Cody ‚ÄúBeef‚Äù Franke dies at 31 after sudden medical issue
content: Barstool Sports is mourning the sudden death of golf personality Cody ‚ÄúBeef‚Äù Franke, who passed away at 31 over the weekend. Franke reportedly experienced a "sudden medical issue" while attending a wedding in the Dominican Republic. Known for his warmth and love for golf, his passing has prompted widespread tributes from fans and colleagues.

title: Women‚Äôs World Cup: Shafali Verma returns; replaces injured Pratika Rawal
content: Shafali Verma replaces Pratika Rawal in India's Women's ODI World Cup 2025 squad due to Rawal's knee and ankle injuries. Rawal's absence is a significant blow, having been a consistent performer with 308 runs. Verma's aggressive batting style and strong domestic form offer India a renewed spark at the top as they face Australia in the semi-final.

title: Ranji Trophy: Fastest! Prithvi Shaw sets 21st-century record with rare batting feat
content: Prithvi Shaw has etched his name in Ranji Trophy history by scoring the fastest double century in the 21st century, reaching the milestone in just 141 balls. This remarkable innings of 222 runs against Chandigarh places him alongside legends like Ravi Shastri and Virender Sehwag for his rapid scoring prowess in first-class cricket.

title: Is LeBron James playing tonight vs Trail Blazers? Lakers star injury update
content: LeBron James is sidelined for the Los Angeles Lakers' October 27, 2025 game against the Portland Trail Blazers due to a persistent sciatic nerve injury. The 40-year-old superstar's absence creates a significant void, impacting the team's leadership and versatility as they face a tough matchup.  His return is tentatively eyed for early November, pending smooth rehabilitation.

title: Scientists spot dangerous ‚Äòtwilight asteroid‚Äô hiding in the sun‚Äôs blinding light
content: Astronomers have identified 2025 SC79, a new asteroid with a remarkably fast 128-day orbit, placing it among the second-fastest ever observed. This "twilight asteroid" orbits close to the Sun, crossing Mercury's path, and poses a significant challenge for detection due to solar glare. Its discovery highlights the dynamic nature of our solar system and the ongoing efforts in planetary defense.

title: Ghee & wine: Inside Delhi woman's 'fiery' plot to kill boyfriend; what was the motive?
content: A live-in relationship turned deadly as a 21-year-old woman, her ex-boyfriend, and his friend allegedly murdered her partner, a UPSC aspirant, in Delhi. They staged the crime as a fire incident to conceal the murder, driven by the victim's alleged possession of objectionable content. The trio has been arrested.

title: Father gets IT notice for selling ancestral land jointly with son - how he won case
content: A father-son duo faced tax issues after jointly selling ancestral land. The purchaser erroneously deducted the entire TDS under the father's name, leading to a notice. The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) Pune ultimately ruled in the father's favor, stating the revenue cannot be unjustly enriched by the deductor's error.

title: Pakistan head coach adds pressure on Babar Azam ahead of T20I comeback
content: Babar Azam is set to return to Pakistan's T20I side at number three against South Africa, his first appearance in the format since December 2024. This strategic move follows Fakhar Zaman's break to focus on domestic cricket. Azam, with an impressive T20I record, is expected to bolster the top order.

title: ‚ÄòNever do a PhD if you‚Äôre not‚Ä¶‚Äô: Google-trained AI founder‚Äôs blunt advice to students
content: Jad Tarifi, founder of Integral AI and former Google AI team member, warns that PhDs may no longer guarantee relevance in the fast-moving AI era. He argues that multi-year degrees risk obsolescence before completion and should only be pursued by those genuinely obsessed with their field. Instead, he advocates learning from life, developing emotional intelligence, and embracing adaptability. Tarifi suggests that passion, not credentials, is the key to staying ahead in a world where technology evolves rapidly.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Stop!' India selectors given warning on Rohit and Virat selection
content: Former captain Krishnamachari Srikkanth urged the BCCI selectors to back Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli for the 2027 World Cup, emphasizing their fitness and recent performances. He advised clear communication, assuring the veterans of their importance and encouraging them to focus on staying fit to lead India to victory.

title: No SIR in Assam? Electoral rolls to be announced separately; EC explains why
content: The Election Commission will conduct a separate Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Assam due to unique legal provisions. Meanwhile, the second phase of SIR will cover 12 states and UTs, aiming to ensure accurate voter lists before upcoming polls.

title: 'Flying Chernobyl': Russia now has nuclear-powered missile; what is Burevestnik?
content: Russia successfully tested its nuclear-powered Burevestnik cruise missile, a weapon President Putin claims can "pierce any defence shield." The test, conducted alongside a nuclear drill, signals Moscow's defiance against Western pressure over Ukraine. Putin announced the country will now move towards deploying the "invincible" missile, which reportedly traveled 14,000 kilometers.

title: Surya‚Äôs form a concern? Gambhir breaks silence: 'We‚Äôve made a decision'
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir backs T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav despite recent batting dips, emphasizing an ultra-aggressive team philosophy where failures are accepted. Gambhir prioritizes a fearless brand of cricket over individual scores, highlighting Suryakumar's leadership and a dressing room culture built on trust and freedom from the fear of losing.

title: Why everyone is talking about Bayern's Lennart Karl
content: Bayern Munich forward Lennart Karl has caught the eye after some fine performances this season. Here's everything you need to know.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Juventus eye move for Chelsea's Gusto
content: Juventus are reportedly looking to add to their defensive depth signing Chelsea's Malo Gusto. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Red-hot Michael Brennan wins in Utah for first tour title
content: Michael Brennan was just as dominant at Black Desert as he was on the PGA Tour Americas. He closed with a 5-under 66 to go from a sponsor exemption to a PGA Tour winner Sunday with his four-shot victory in the Bank of Utah Championship.

title: IRCTC scam case: Lalu Yadav, Rabri Devi ask Delhi court not to conduct day-to-day trial
content: Say day-to-day hearings are happening in three other cases and ask for time to read the chargesheet and court order

title: CM okays land for railway coaching terminals at Amaravati, Gannavaram
content: Chandrababu Naidu orders immediate release of ‚Çπ27 crore for next phase of work on new Nadikudi-Srikalahasti railway line, moots Integrated Logistics Park, high-speed elevated railway corridors on Hyderabad-Bengaluru and Hyderabad-Chennai routes via Amaravati

title: Fill vacant posts in agricultural institutes, Chouhan tells ICAR, States
content: The Union Minister stressed the need to develop agriculture-related educational infrastructure and enable self-reliance

title: Three-day national conference of school boards in Hyderabad from Oct. 29
content: Delegates ranging from chairpersons of school boards and policy experts, to representatives from international affiliates such as Cambridge and the International Baccalaureate (IB) will be present to share knowledge on assessment reforms, quality assurance, skill education and digital learning ecosystems

title: Willing to work, even without pay, during monsoon, protesting conservancy workers tell Madras High Court
content: They say they are making the unconditional and voluntary offer as a gesture of goodwill and in the interest of the residents of Chennai

title: Great Nicobar Island Project: over 70 experts, scientists write to Environment Minister on ‚Äògrave‚Äô, irreversible‚Äô impact
content: The letter, made public and sent to Bhupender Yadav‚Äôs office as well, was in response to the Environment Minister‚Äôs article in The Hindu last month, in which he defended the project

title: CCB busts international cybercrime racket, arrests two
content: The accused had hacked into the accounts of a private firm and transferred ‚Çπ47 crore within two and a half hours on October 6

title: Omar Abdullah calls out cross-voters, ‚Äòdestruction of votes‚Äô in J&K Rajya Sabha election
content: The issue of cross-voting gripped the J&K Assembly on Monday as members of the ruling alliance raised slogans of ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô (stealing)

title: 47 schools in Kerala had zero students in 2024-25: Union Ministry data
content: These schools also had 19 teachers to teach students. None of these schools are in the government sector, clarifies Samagra Shiksha Kerala

title: Srisailam wears festive look on first Monday of ‚ÄôKarthika Masam‚Äô
content: The temple pond, Pushkarini, was lit up with 1 lakh lamps as part of ‚ÄôLaksha Deepotsavam‚Äô, while ‚ÄòPushkarini Harathi‚Äô was performed on the occasion

title: Cricket fever grips Karimnagar as district hosts first official HCA league matches
content: Karimnagar earned the unique distinction of being the first district in Telangana to host the official A-Level HCA League matches outside Hyderabad

title: Shadow of Sabarimala looms large as Pandalam prepares for another poll battle
content: BJP, seeking a second straight term, exudes confidence.  Determined to widen its successful strategy of combining Hindu and Christian voters and stamp Pandalam as a ‚Äòsaffron fort,‚Äô the party has already completed groundwork.  Riding on council‚Äôs administrative lapses, LDF plans to corner BJP over its governance record. UDF is also attempting a comeback attempt, riding on the  Sabarimala sentiment. Its ‚Äúfaith protection marches‚Äù culminated in a grand show of strength here

title: Hospital retrieves man‚Äôs body from home after it forgets to do autopsy
content: Hospital officials say they forgot to conduct post-mortem examination thinking that it was a natural death as he died after a month‚Äôs treatment

title: Tenant farmers reel under steep lease rates, lack of support in Andhra Pradesh: survey
content: A.P. Tenant Farmers‚Äô Union study across all 26 districts finds most cultivators landless, uninsured, and excluded from crop registration and credit access

title: Karnataka coffee growers welcome Modi‚Äôs praise, seek action on long-pending challenges
content: In his monthly radio broadcast, Modi lauded the distinctive character and diversity of Indian coffee, saying it has carved a ‚Äòunique identity‚Äô on the world stage

title: Punnapra-Vayalar uprising served as inspiration for future struggles: Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan inaugurates the valedictory function of  anniversary of the Punnapra-Vayalar uprising at Vayalar.

title: Chief Secretary directs power utilities to stay on high alert for Cyclone Montha
content: Vijayanand reviews readiness of Genco, Transco and DISCOMs; calls for seamless coordination and quick power restoration in coastal areas

title: Great Nicobar project will boost India‚Äôs maritime global trade, says Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah outlines plans for shipping sector at India Maritime Week; 680 MoUs worth ‚Çπ10 lakh crore likely to be signed

title: Delhi to bar entry of non-BS-VI compliant vehicles registered outside city from Nov. 1
content: Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) approved a sweeping ban on the entry of polluting commercial vehicles into Delhi from November 1, amid the city's pollution woes.

title: Naidu orders coastal evacuations, vows zero casualties as Cyclone Montha nears
content: State government steps up preparedness with real-time monitoring, relief centres, and preventive measures in vulnerable regions under the Chief Minister‚Äôs directives

title: BJP leadership seeks explanation from Palakkad municipal chairperson
content: Rift within BJP comes to the fore as a section turns against Prameela Sasidharan for attending function attended by Rahul Mamkootathil

title: Cyclone Montha: Nandyal and Kurnool administration put on alert
content: Nandyal Collector asks farmers to take necessary precautions to avoid crop losses as there is a possibility of the district bearing the impact of the cyclone

title: Bihar Assembly polls: CPI(ML) candidate is fighting ‚Äòbig money‚Äô with small donations
content: CPI(ML)‚Äôs Arrah candidate Quyamuddin Ansari says wherever he goes, he spreads a ‚Äútowel in front of the people, and they contribute‚Äù, he is confident that this time the people will throw the NDA out of power

title: Rajasthan bars children below 14 from working in shops, commercial establishments
content: The State also approved amendments to the Rajasthan Factories (Amendment) Rules, 2025, aimed at promoting business activities while ensuring the welfare and safety of workers, according to a statement

title: Seethathodu-Nilackal drinking water project commissioned ahead of Sabarimala season
content: Implemented at a cost of ‚Çπ84.38 crore, the project aims to provide round-the-clock access to safe drinking water for the lakhs of pilgrims visiting Nilackal every season

title: SAAP Chairman slams YSRCP, Sakshi media for spreading false propoganda
content: After the probe over the irregularities in the liquor scam is completed, the coalition government will  take action against those involved in the Aadudam Andhra scandal, says Ravi Naidu

title: Why the rush for SIR in other States, ask Opposition parties
content: Opposition questions EC‚Äôs move when Supreme Court is looking into Bihar SIR; Parties fear legitimate voters will be removed from rolls; Kerala Assembly passes resolution against exercise

title: GHMC to penalise the high absenteeism among sanitation workers
content: High absenteeism among the sanitation workers in the city is affecting the road sweeping services adversely, officials say, justifying the penal action

title: 6.1 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Turkey, Damaging Buildings
content: A strong earthquake shook western Turkey on Monday, the country's emergency response agency said. Media reports said some buildings sustained damage, but there were no immediate reports of casualties.

title: 17-Year-Old Boy Drowns During Chhath Puja Celebrations In UP
content: A 17-year-old boy drowned during Chhath Puja celebrations here on Monday, while another is feared missing, police said.

title: Meta's Mark Zuckerberg Appoints Vishal Shah To Key AI Role
content: Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg has appointed insider Vishal Shah to a key artificial intelligence-linked role, heading product management for AI products, the social media giant said on Monday.

title: King Charles Heckled Over Brother Prince Andrew's Ties To Jeffrey Epstein
content: King Charles was heckled by a protester on Monday over his brother Prince Andrew's ties to the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein while greeting royal fans during a cathedral visit in Britain.

title: Delhi To Ban Entry Of These Vehicles From November 1 As Air Quality Dips
content: A public notice issued by the transport department said BS-IV commercial goods vehicles will be permitted to enter Delhi up to October 31, as a transitional measure.

title: Woman, Fiance Strangle Man Over Blackmail Threats, Arrested
content: The Faridabad Police on Monday arrested a woman and her fiance for allegedly killing an insurance agent and dumping his body in a drain here.

title: IndiGo Starts Direct Flights From Mumbai To London
content: Expanding its international network, IndiGo on Monday said it has commenced direct daily flights connecting Mumbai and London.

title: RG Kar Doctor Dies Under Mysterious Circumstances: Cops
content: Kolkata, Oct 27 (IANS) A doctor at Kolkata's RG Kar Medical College and Hospital has died under mysterious circumstances, the police said on Monday.

title: Supreme Court Refuses Contempt Action For Shoe Thrown At Chief Justice
content: The Supreme Court on Monday refused to initiate contempt action against a lawyer who had attempted to throw a shoe at Chief Justice of India BR Gavai but said it will consider laying down guidelines to prevent such incidents.

title: Delhi's First Cloud Seeding Likely Today If Weather Permits
content: The Delhi government may conduct its first cloud seeding trial on Tuesday if weather conditions are favourable, an official said.

title: In Delhi Acid Attack Case, "Toilet Cleaner" Twist And A Huge Confession
content: The woman's father has now been detained by the Delhi Police for masterminding the fake acid story to frame the three men. He has confessed that he plotted the whole conspiracy, said the Delhi Police.

title: Assam Planning 7-Year Jail For Polygamy In New Bill
content: The proposed law against polygamy will have a punishment of at least seven years, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said on Monday.

title: DMK, Allies Oppose Voter List Revision In Tamil Nadu, Call It 'Conspiracy'
content: Hours after the Election Commission announced voter roll revision in 12 states, including poll-bound Tamil Nadu, the DMK and its allies accused the poll body of acting with political motives.

title: From Trade To Rare Earth: A Look At Trump's Deals On First Leg Of Asia Tour
content: US President Donald Trump signed a flurry of trade deals and framework agreements with Southeast Asian governments on Sunday as his sweep through the region began at a summit in Malaysia.

title: Delivery Agent Arrested For Sexual Assault Of Brazilian Model In Bengaluru
content: A Blinkit delivery agent was arrested on Saturday for sexually harassing a 21-year-old Brazilian model while delivering an order at her residence in Bengaluru's RT Nagar area.

title: We Must Stay Prepared For War-Like Situations, Says Rajnath Singh
content: India must remain ready for a "war-like situation," as the four-day military conflict with Pakistan in May showed anything can happen anytime along the frontiers, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said on Monday.

title: On Karnataka Leadership Change Query, Siddaramaiah Points To "High Command"
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Monday said he would continue in office for the full five-year term, subject to the decision of the Congress high command.

title: Police Officers Expected To Treat Women With Dignity: Delhi High Court
content: The Delhi High Court has observed that police officers are expected to treat women with dignity and must refrain from using inappropriate or unparliamentary language.

title: 'To Gain Muslim Votes': Minister On Tejashwi Yadavs Waqf Act Remarks
content: Kiren Rijiju on Monday lashed out at RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav over his remarks on the Waqf Amendment Act, saying that he "lacks maturity" and is making such statements merely to "appease the Muslim community" ahead of Bihar polls

title: Madhya Pradesh Cop Alleges Police Hand In Drug Trade
content: In an explosive revelation that has sent shockwaves through Madhya Pradesh's law enforcement system, a senior IPS officer has openly alleged that policemen themselves are knee-deep in the illegal trade of narcotic cough syrups.

title: Cyclone Montha: Holiday declared for Chennai schools
content:
Chennai: Chennai district collector Rashmi Siddharth Zagade on Monday declared a holiday for schools in the city on Tuesday in view of rain triggered by cyclone Montha. Schools will remain closed on Tuesday in Tiruvallur district too.

title: Ranking 80 men's NCAA basketball teams by March Madness potential

title: ‚Å†Fantasy hockey pickups: Plan for Frozen Frenzy with Blues and Blue Jackets
content: we'll mine the waiver wire for lesser-rostered performers who have the potential to help fantasy teams in a variety of leagues . Tuesday's Frozen Frenzy headlines the schedule with 16 games -- with one starting every 15 minutes beginning at 6 p.m. ET . Thursday and Saturday also deliver heavy slates with 11 and 13 games .

title: How the FBI says poker games were rigged
content: the case focused on rigged poker games is one of two announced that allegedly involve prominent NBA figures . investigators state that the scheme began in April 2019 when defendant Robert "Black Rob" Stroud and other co-conspirators devised a ruse to use technology to rig illegal poker games against unwitting, wealthy players . in many cases, every other person at the poker table at the same time believed these were "straight" games against other wealthy players.

title: How the matchups line up for all 46 postseason games
content: all four of those teams are in the mix for the college football Playoff . the five highest-ranked conference champions, plus the next seven highest-rated teams, will make the field . last season's inaugural 12-team CFP, the five most-ranked conferences champions will be awarded first-round byes .

title: Week 9 Power Rankings: Top 5 stays consistent; Houston and Utah join the list
content: Ole Miss' road win against Oklahoma makes the Rebels a virtual lock for the playoff . deion Sanders summed it up after watching his team give up 587 yards of offense in a 53-7 loss to Utah . "this is probably the worst beating I've ever had except when my momma whooped me as a kid," Sanders said .

title: Rams acquire CB McCreary in trade with Titans
content: the Los Angeles Rams have added to their cornerback room, acquiring Roger McCreary . the Titans will receive a 2026 conditional fifth-round pick along with the cornerback . he is in the final season of his rookie contract, but has experience playing outside .

title: From crashing on couches to crushing grand slams: 5 under-the-radar Blue Jays bashers you need to know
content: the Toronto Blue Jays hit coach was a hit coordinator for the high-A Great Lakes Loons . he oversaw the Twins hitters for three years, helping guide an offense that ranked 11th in wRC+ and 13th in runs scored over the stretch . popkins was made a scapegoat for the big league club .
